title: Kate Mara stuns in see-through midi dress as she is joined by husband Jamie Bell at Governors Awards
text:
They starred in the critically-panned Fantastic Four reboot from 2015 together.

But Kate Mara and Jamie Bell will surely be praised for their latest looks on the red carpet.

The 36-year-old actress and her 33-year-old husband looked fantastic as they attended the 11th Annual Governors Awards gala hosted by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences on Sunday.

Dynamic duo: Kate Mara and Jamie Bell looked fantastic as they attended the 11th Annual Governors Awards gala hosted by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences on Sunday

Kate flaunted her fab figure in a completely see-through dress at the star-studded affair at the Dolby Theater in Hollywood.

Her brunette tresses were put in a middle-part tucked behind her ears as her natural, complementary make-up was contrasted with bright red lipstick.

Jamie looked handsome in a black tuxedo with a crisp white dress shirt and black bowtie.

Wow factor: The 36-year-old actress flaunted her fab figure in a completely see-through dress at the star-studded affair at the Dolby Theater in Hollywood

PRetty: Her brunette tresses were put in a middle-part tucked behind her ears as her natural, complementary make-up was contrasted with bright red lipstick

The mesh number featured an asymmetrical skirt as she wore a black bra and underskirt.

It was a night full of Hollywood's top talents as Scarlett Johansson, Jennifer Lopez and Charlize Theron led the star parade at the gala.

Scarlett's chicness couldn't be denied as she stepped onto the red carpet in the flank-flaunting gold and black look.

All stars: Scarlett Johansson wowed while leading the red carpet of The Academy's Governors Awards with Jennifer Lopez and Charlize Theron on Sunday

Although already glamorous, she dressed up the look with earrings, gold cuffs and metallic heels which perfectly matched her dress.

Every detail was in order as the fiance of Colin Jost painted her face with a sultry cat-eye touched with gold glitter. Letting her bold makeup look take center-stage, the actress smoothed her hair into a center part to style it back sleekly

Jennifer Lopez also glowed, donning a silky strapless citron Reem Acra gown to the affair.

A bit of skin: Scarlett's chicness couldn't be denied as she stepped onto the red carpet in the flank-flaunting gold and black Celine look

Matchy matchy: Although already glamorous, she dressed up the look with earrings, gold cuffs and metallic heels which perfectly matched her dress

Wowing: The back of Scarlett's dress was even more alluring

The Hustlers actress' dress billowed down from her bust, flowing to the floor with an A-line silhouette. Turning around to show off her angles, she revealed a satin bow at the back.

Jennifer drew attention to her decolletage with a stunned double layered diamond necklace and glimmering earrings. Rounding out the mother of two's accessories was a boxy onyx clutch.

She braided her hair up and away from her face while going for full glamour with a dramatic bronze makeup look.

Silky smooth: Jennifer Lopez glowed in a silky strapless citron Reem Acra gown

Wink: Jennifer winked over her shoulder while strutted her stuff for the photogs

Darling detail: Turning around to show off her angles, she revealed a satin bow at the back

Charlize Theron embraced timeless style in a black and white Tom Ford ensemble which teamed a simple tunic with a full creme skirt. She carried a small purse and added a bit of sparkle with diamond huggie earrings.

She went for a natural beauty look by playing up her already stunning features with a hint of bronzer and nude lips.

All the white, the Bombshell actress kept her cropped 'do styled sleekly.

Timeless: Charlize Theron embraced timeless style in a black and white Tom Ford ensemble which teamed a simple tunic with a full creme skirt
description: The 36-year-old actress and her 33-year-old husband looked fantastic as they  attended the 11th Annual Governors Awards gala hosted by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.
